item.title: Power Analysis for an Unconditional Growth Model Using a Selected Sample
item.description: (Updated: 2020-12-31) Problem Statement Determine whether, given what we know about the target phenomenon, a sample of 120 subjects, measured at three time points is sufficient to detect linear change in an unconditional growth model. A trained phlebotomist once described her experience trying to pierce a patient’s vein with her needle as akin to “Trying to use a toothpick to stick a wet noodle covered by a piece of wax paper.
